step.content: Navigate to the chat page.
Enter a valid query, such as 'latest news about AI'
step.expected: The valid query is entered

step.content: Click the 'Send' button to submit the query.
step.expected: The search results for the query are displayed without any errors.

step.content: Verify that the search results are relevant to the query.
step.expected: The search results are relevant and contain information about the latest news on AI.

step.content: Navigate to the user request submission form.
step.expected: The user request submission form is displayed.

step.content: Leave the user request field empty and click the submit button.
step.expected: An error or validation message is displayed indicating that the user request field is required.

step.content: Verify the error or validation message.
step.expected: The error or validation message clearly states that the user request field is required and cannot be empty.

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface as an unlogged user.
step.expected: The chat interface is accessible without logging in.

step.content: Start a new chat.
step.expected: The chat is successfully started and saved.

step.content: Start a second chat.
step.expected: The second chat is successfully started and saved.

step.content: Attempt to start a third chat.
step.expected: An error notification is displayed indicating that the limit of two chats for unlogged users has been reached.

step.content: Navigate to the application deployment page.
step.expected: The application deployment page is accessible.

step.content: Attempt to deploy the application without logging in.
step.expected: A prompt to log in appears, and the deployment process is not initiated.

step.content: Log in to the application.
step.expected: Successfully logged in to the application.

step.content: Attempt to deploy the application again after logging in.
step.expected: The deployment process is initiated successfully.

step.content: Log in to the application using valid credentials.
step.expected: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

step.content: Close the browser tab.
step.expected: The browser tab is closed.

step.content: Open the application in a new browser tab.
step.expected: The application opens in a new browser tab.

step.content: Verify that the user is still logged in.
step.expected: The user is still logged in and can access the dashboard without needing to log in again.

step.content: Open 11 incognito tabs in your browser.
step.expected: All tabs should open successfully.

step.content: Try to start a chat in each of the 11 incognito tabs.
step.expected: You should be able to start a chat in the first 2 tabs, but the third tab and onwards should display an error notification stating that you cannot start a new chat.

step.content: Verify the error notification in the third tab and beyond.
step.expected: The error notification should read something like 'You cannot start a new chat. You have reached the limit of 2 chats for unlogged users.'

step.content: Start a chat session.
step.expected: Chat session starts successfully.

step.content: Initiate a process within the chat.
step.expected: Process starts within the chat.

step.content: Attempt to click the Approve button.
step.expected: The Approve button is disabled and cannot be clicked.

step.content: Wait for the process to complete.
step.expected: The process completes successfully.

step.content: Attempt to click the Approve button again after the process is complete.
step.expected: The Approve button is now enabled and can be clicked.

step.content: Start a chat session.
step.expected: Chat session is initiated.

step.content: Send a request to the AI to start processing.
step.expected: AI processing starts and a notification is displayed indicating the AI is in process.

step.content: Attempt to send a message to the AI.
step.expected: A restriction notification is displayed, indicating that messages cannot be sent while the AI is in process.

step.content: Wait for the AI processing to complete.
step.expected: AI processing completes and the chat session is no longer restricted.

step.content: Send a message to the AI after processing is complete.
step.expected: The message is sent successfully without any restriction notifications.

case.title: Retrieve Content from a Valid URL

step.content: Open the application and navigate to the web scraping feature.
step.expected: The web scraping feature is accessible and ready for use.

step.content: Enter a valid URL into the input field.
step.expected: The URL is accepted without errors.

step.content: Provide a valid CSS selector to extract specific data from the web page.
step.expected: The CSS selector is accepted without errors.

step.content: Initiate the web scraping process.
step.expected: The system starts the web scraping process and retrieves the specified content.

step.content: Verify that the expected HTML content is returned and displayed correctly.
step.expected: The HTML content is returned and displayed as expected.

case.title: Verify Welcome Notification on App Start

step.content: Trigger the application build process with a valid user request.
step.expected: The application build process starts successfully.

step.content: Verify that a welcome notification is sent.
step.expected: A welcome message is published and the flow transitions to the greeting_sent state.

case.title: Verify Functional Requirement Questions Are Asked

step.content: Trigger the process_initial_question.
step.expected: The system should ask the first functional requirement question.

step.content: Engage in back-and-forth clarification with the system.
step.expected: The system should ask follow-up questions based on the initial response to clarify the functional requirements.

step.content: Provide responses to the questions.
step.expected: The system should acknowledge the responses and ask additional questions if necessary.

step.content: Continue the clarification process until all functional requirements are gathered.
step.expected: The system should transition to the app_requirements_requested state and gather all necessary input.

step.content: Verify that all functional requirements have been clarified.
step.expected: The system should confirm that all functional requirements have been gathered and clarified.

case.title: Verify Complete Set of Functional Requirements

step.content: Complete the requirement gathering process.
step.expected: The application transitions to the app_requirements_requested state.

step.content: Trigger the generation of functional requirements.
step.expected: A markdown file named functional_requirement.md is generated.

step.content: Verify the content of the functional_requirement.md file.
step.expected: The file contains a complete set of functional requirements as per the application's needs.

step.content: Use finalized requirements to trigger prototype generation.
step.expected: A functional prototype.py file is saved to the entity directory.

step.content: Check the entity directory for the presence of prototype.py file.
step.expected: The prototype.py file exists in the entity directory.

case.title: Verify Prototype Conversion to Cyoda Format

step.content: Open the application prototype file.
step.expected: The prototype file should be accessible and open in the editor.

step.content: Identify the prototype code that needs to be converted to Cyoda format.
step.expected: The relevant sections of the prototype code should be clearly identifiable.

step.content: Convert the identified prototype code to Cyoda format.
step.expected: The code should be successfully refactored to match the Cyoda format, including the use of entity_service.

step.content: Save the refactored prototype file as 'prototype_cyoda.py'.
step.expected: The file should be saved with the correct name and location.

step.content: Verify the content of 'prototype_cyoda.py' to ensure it follows the Cyoda format.
step.expected: The file should contain the refactored code in the correct Cyoda format, including proper usage of entity_service.

case.title: Verify JSON Structure for Application Entities

step.content: Navigate to the entity design section in the application.
step.expected: The entity design section should be accessible and visible.

step.content: Trigger the generation of the JSON structure for the application's entities.
step.expected: The JSON structure should be generated successfully.

step.content: Verify the generated JSON structure for correctness.
step.expected: The JSON structure should match the expected format and contain all necessary fields and properties.

step.content: Check if the JSON structure is saved correctly.
step.expected: The JSON structure should be saved without any errors.

step.content: Navigate to the workflow editor and open the workflow JSON file.
step.expected: The workflow JSON file is opened and displayed correctly.

step.content: Verify the structure and content of the workflow JSON file.
step.expected: The workflow JSON file contains the correct structure and content as per the workflow design.

step.content: Generate the workflow code from the JSON file.
step.expected: The workflow code is generated successfully without any errors.

step.content: Review the generated workflow code.
step.expected: The generated workflow code matches the expected code based on the workflow JSON file.

step.content: Save the generated workflow code.
step.expected: The workflow code is saved successfully.

step.content: Generate the workflow code for the application.
step.expected: Workflow code is generated successfully.

step.content: Register the workflow code within the system.
step.expected: Workflow code is registered successfully without any errors.

step.content: Verify the registration by checking the system logs or workflow list.
step.expected: The workflow code appears in the system logs or workflow list, indicating successful registration.

step.content: Complete the application building process by following the provided instructions.
step.expected: The application building process should complete successfully.

step.content: Check if the .env template is saved.
step.expected: The .env template should be saved and available for use.

step.content: Verify that the user is notified with setup instructions.
step.expected: A notification with setup instructions should be sent to the user.

case.title: Verify User Notification with Setup Instructions

step.content: Complete the application building process by saving the .env template and notifying the user with setup instructions.
step.expected: .env.template is saved and instructions sent to user.

step.content: Check the user's notification for setup instructions.
step.expected: The user receives a notification with setup instructions.

step.content: Verify the content of the notification.
step.expected: The notification contains clear and detailed setup instructions.

step.content: Navigate to the web scraping function interface.
step.expected: The web scraping function interface is displayed.

step.content: Enter a valid URL in the URL field.
step.expected: The URL field accepts the input and displays the entered URL.

step.content: Enter a valid CSS selector in the CSS selector field.
step.expected: The CSS selector field accepts the input and displays the entered CSS selector.

step.content: Click the 'Scrape' button to initiate the web scraping process.
step.expected: The web scraping process starts and the expected HTML content is returned.

step.content: Verify that the returned HTML content matches the expected content based on the provided CSS selector.
step.expected: The returned HTML content matches the expected content based on the provided CSS selector.

step.content: Navigate to the application interface where a user can input a URL.
step.expected: The interface should display a field or prompt for entering a URL.

step.content: Enter a valid URL for a financial news site, such as 'https://www.bloomberg.com'.
step.expected: The application should accept the URL without any error messages.

step.content: Submit the entered URL.
step.expected: The application should process the URL and begin scraping or retrieving data from the specified site.

step.content: Verify that the application successfully retrieves and displays data from the entered URL.
step.expected: The application should show relevant financial news data or content from the specified URL.

step.content: Navigate to the application settings page.
step.expected: The application settings page is displayed.

step.content: Modify the application's settings or code.
step.expected: The modified settings or code are visible in the settings page.

step.content: Save the changes.
step.expected: A confirmation message is displayed indicating that the settings have been saved successfully.

step.content: Verify the changes by checking the application's behavior or output.
step.expected: The application behaves or outputs according to the updated settings.

step.content: Navigate to the application's data model section.
step.expected: The current data model is displayed.

step.content: Define the properties of the new data entity.
step.expected: The properties of the new data entity are successfully defined.

step.content: Integrate the new data entity into the application's data model.
step.expected: The new data entity is successfully integrated into the application's data model.

step.content: Verify the integration by checking if the new data entity is listed in the data model.
step.expected: The new data entity is listed in the application's data model.

step.content: Test the new data entity by creating a new record.
step.expected: A new record is successfully created using the new data entity.

step.content: Navigate to the workflow management section of the application.
step.expected: The workflow management section is displayed.

step.content: Click on the 'Add New Workflow' button.
step.expected: The workflow creation form is displayed.

step.content: Define the trigger for the new workflow.
step.expected: The trigger is successfully defined.

step.content: Add actions to the workflow.
step.expected: The actions are successfully added to the workflow.

step.content: Save the new workflow.
step.expected: The new workflow is saved successfully.

step.content: Verify that the new workflow appears in the list of workflows.
step.expected: The new workflow is listed among the existing workflows.

step.content: Navigate to the API settings section of the application.
step.expected: The API settings page is displayed.

step.content: Select the API to modify.
step.expected: The selected API's settings are displayed.

step.content: Modify the API settings (e.g., change the endpoint URL, authentication method, etc.).
step.expected: The modified settings are saved successfully.

step.content: Verify the changes by making a test API call.
step.expected: The test API call returns the expected response, confirming the settings have been applied correctly.

step.content: Navigate to the workflow management section of the application.
step.expected: The workflow management section is displayed.

step.content: Select the existing workflow to be modified.
step.expected: The selected workflow is opened for editing.

step.content: Edit the workflow by adding a new transition or modifying an existing one.
step.expected: The workflow is updated with the new transition or modified transition.

step.content: Save the changes to the workflow.
step.expected: The changes are saved successfully and the workflow is updated.

step.content: Verify that the changes are reflected in the workflow diagram and JSON.
step.expected: The changes are visible in both the workflow diagram and JSON representation.

step.content: Navigate to the data processors section in the application.
step.expected: The data processors section is displayed with a list of existing processors.

step.content: Select an existing data processor to modify.
step.expected: The selected data processor's configuration and logic are displayed for editing.

step.content: Modify the configuration or logic of the selected data processor.
step.expected: The changes to the configuration or logic are saved successfully.

step.content: Verify the changes by running a test or checking the processor's behavior.
step.expected: The data processor behaves according to the modified configuration or logic.

step.content: Navigate to the data entity management section of the application.
step.expected: The data entity management section is displayed.

step.content: Select the data entity to be modified.
step.expected: The selected data entity is highlighted or opened for editing.

step.content: Modify the properties of the selected data entity.
step.expected: The properties of the selected data entity are updated with the new values.

step.content: Save the changes to the data entity.
step.expected: The changes to the data entity are saved successfully.

step.content: Verify that the data entity has been modified correctly.
step.expected: The modified data entity is displayed with the updated properties.

step.content: Submit user_request: "Deploy Cyoda environment".
step.expected: Cyoda environment deployment starts and returns confirmation.

step.content: Verify the deployment confirmation message.
step.expected: A confirmation message indicating the successful deployment of the Cyoda environment is displayed.

step.content: Navigate to the Cyoda platform.
step.expected: The Cyoda platform homepage is displayed.

step.content: Locate and click on the 'Get Cyoda Guidelines' option.
step.expected: The Cyoda guidelines page is displayed.

step.content: Review the guidelines for using the Cyoda platform.
step.expected: The guidelines are accessible and readable.

step.content: Ensure the Cyoda environment is up and running.
step.expected: The Cyoda environment is active and ready for deployment.

step.content: Submit a user request to deploy the application using the specified Git branch.
step.expected: The deployment process starts successfully.

step.content: Verify the deployment confirmation message.
step.expected: A confirmation message is displayed indicating the application has been deployed.

step.content: Access the API documentation to verify the deployment.
step.expected: The API documentation is available and accessible at the provided URL.

step.content: Start a chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: Chat is successfully started.

step.content: Start a second chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: Second chat is successfully started.

step.content: Attempt to start a third chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: An error notification is displayed indicating that the limit of two chats has been reached.

step.content: Start the first chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: The first chat is successfully started.

step.content: Start the second chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: The second chat is successfully started.

step.content: Attempt to start the third chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: An error notification is displayed indicating that the limit of two chats has been exceeded.

step.content: Start a chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: Chat is successfully started.

step.content: Start a second chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: Second chat is successfully started.

step.content: Wait for the specified period of inactivity.
step.expected: The system recognizes the period of inactivity.

step.content: Start a third chat as an unlogged user.
step.expected: Third chat is successfully started, indicating the chat limit has reset.

step.content: Open the workflow editor.
step.expected: The workflow editor interface is displayed.

step.content: Create a new state named 'state_1'.
step.expected: A new state named 'state_1' is created in the workflow editor.

step.content: Create another new state named 'state_2'.
step.expected: A new state named 'state_2' is created in the workflow editor.

step.content: Add a transition from 'state_1' to 'state_2'.
step.expected: A transition is added from 'state_1' to 'state_2' in the workflow editor.

step.content: Save the workflow.
step.expected: The workflow is saved successfully.

step.content: Verify the workflow structure in the JSON representation.
step.expected: The JSON representation of the workflow shows two states and one transition.

step.content: Open the workflow editor.
step.expected: The workflow editor opens with the current workflow displayed.

step.content: Click on the 'states' section in the workflow editor.
step.expected: The states section expands to show the list of states in the workflow.

step.content: Edit the name of an existing state, for example, change 'state_1' to 'new_state_1'.
step.expected: The state name is updated in the workflow editor.

step.content: Save the changes to the workflow.
step.expected: The changes are saved and the workflow editor reflects the updated state name.

step.content: Check the JSON representation of the workflow to verify the state name change.
step.expected: The JSON representation shows the updated state name 'new_state_1'.

step.content: Verify the changes in the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The workflow diagram reflects the updated state name 'new_state_1'.

step.content: Open the workflow editor for the specified workflow.
step.expected: The workflow editor opens with the current workflow diagram and JSON displayed.

step.content: Select a transition to edit.
step.expected: The selected transition is highlighted in the diagram and its details are shown in the editor.

step.content: Modify the transition name, next state, and manual flag.
step.expected: The transition details in the editor are updated with the new values.

step.content: Save the changes.
step.expected: A confirmation message appears indicating that the workflow has been saved successfully.

step.content: Verify the changes in the JSON representation.
step.expected: The JSON representation of the workflow shows the updated transition details.

step.content: Verify the changes in the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The workflow diagram reflects the updated transition details, including the new name, next state, and manual flag.

step.content: Open the workflow editor and select an existing workflow to edit.
step.expected: The selected workflow is loaded into the editor.

step.content: Change the name of the workflow in the workflow properties.
step.expected: The name of the workflow is updated in the workflow properties.

step.content: Verify the changes in the JSON representation of the workflow.
step.expected: The updated name is reflected in the JSON file.

step.content: Verify the changes in the workflow diagram.
step.expected: The updated name is displayed in the workflow diagram.

step.content: Save the changes to the workflow.
step.expected: The workflow is saved with the updated properties.

step.content: Reload the workflow editor and verify the changes are still present.
step.expected: The updated properties are still present in both the JSON and the diagram.

step.content: Start a chat session.
step.expected: Chat session starts successfully.

step.content: Double approve a response.
step.expected: System should not allow double approval and show an error message.

step.content: Rollback to a previous step.
step.expected: System should allow rollback and return to the previous step.

step.content: Ask a question and provide a wrong answer.
step.expected: System should not accept the wrong answer and prompt for a correct response.

step.content: Ask to proceed to another (wrong) step.
step.expected: System should not allow proceeding to an incorrect step and show an error message.

step.content: Trigger application build with a valid user_request.
step.expected: Welcome notification is sent.

step.content: Verify that the welcome message is published.
step.expected: The welcome message is published.

step.content: Check the flow transition to the greeting_sent state.
step.expected: The flow transitions to the greeting_sent state.

case.title: Verify Workflow Start with Welcome Notification

step.content: Trigger the application build process with a valid user request.
step.expected: The application build process starts successfully.

step.content: Verify that a welcome notification is sent.
step.expected: A welcome message is published and the flow transitions to the greeting_sent state.

step.content: Create an initial application prototype based on finalized requirements.
step.expected: A functional prototype.py file is saved to the entity directory.

step.content: Navigate to the entity directory and verify the existence of the prototype.py file.
step.expected: The prototype.py file is present in the entity directory.

case.title: Edit Application Settings with Minimal Changes

step.content: Navigate to the application settings page.
step.expected: The application settings page is displayed.

step.content: Modify a single setting, such as the application name, to a new value.
step.expected: The application name is updated to the new value.

step.content: Save the changes.
step.expected: The changes are saved successfully and a confirmation message is displayed.

step.content: Verify the updated setting by checking the application name on the settings page.
step.expected: The application name reflects the new value entered.

case.title: Integrate New Data Entity with Existing Schema

step.content: Navigate to the application's data management section.
step.expected: The data management section is displayed.

step.content: Select the option to add a new data entity.
step.expected: The form to add a new data entity is displayed.

step.content: Define the properties of the new entity, ensuring they follow the existing schema.
step.expected: The properties of the new entity are defined correctly.

step.content: Save the new entity.
step.expected: The new entity is saved successfully.

step.content: Verify that the new entity is listed in the application's data entities.
step.expected: The new entity is listed among the existing entities.

step.content: Check the application's functionality to ensure the new entity is integrated properly.
step.expected: The application functions correctly with the new entity integrated.

case.title: Incorporate New Automated Process with Existing Workflow

step.content: Define the new automated process by specifying its trigger and actions.
step.expected: The new process is defined with a clear trigger and set of actions.

step.content: Integrate the new workflow with the application's existing events.
step.expected: The new workflow is successfully integrated with the application's events.

step.content: Verify that the new workflow is listed in the application's workflow management section.
step.expected: The new workflow appears in the list of workflows.

step.content: Test the new workflow by triggering its defined actions.
step.expected: The workflow executes as expected, performing the defined actions.

step.content: Check the application logs for any errors or warnings related to the new workflow.
step.expected: No errors or warnings related to the new workflow are present in the logs.

case.title: Modify API Settings with Security Compliance

step.content: Navigate to the API settings section of the application.
step.expected: The API settings page is displayed.

step.content: Modify the API endpoint URL to a new secure URL.
step.expected: The new URL is saved successfully.

step.content: Update the API key to a new secure key.
step.expected: The new API key is saved successfully.

step.content: Enable security compliance checks for the API.
step.expected: Security compliance checks are enabled.

step.content: Save the changes to the API settings.
step.expected: Changes are saved successfully and a confirmation message is displayed.

step.content: Verify that the API is functioning correctly with the new settings.
step.expected: API requests are successful and return the expected responses.

step.content: Check the security compliance status of the API.
step.expected: The API is marked as compliant with security standards.

case.title: AI Mode Activation on File Upload

step.content: Navigate to the chat interface and upload a file.
step.expected: The chat interface should display a message indicating that 'optimized' mode has been activated.

step.content: Check the chat history for any messages offering a choice between 'optimized' and 'regular' modes.
step.expected: There should be no messages offering a choice between 'optimized' and 'regular' modes.

step.content: Verify that the application is being generated in 'optimized' mode.
step.expected: The application should be generated in 'optimized' mode as indicated by the chat interface.

case.title: AI Mode Selection for 299 Characters Input

step.content: Enter 299 characters into the text input field.
step.expected: The AI does not display a message offering a choice between 'optimized' and 'regular' mode.

step.content: Check the application's mode.
step.expected: The application is in 'optimized' mode.

case.title: AI Mode Activation for Text Over 300 Characters

step.content: Enter a text input that exceeds 300 characters into the chat.
step.expected: The AI should automatically save the text as a file and display a message indicating that 'optimized' mode has been activated.

step.content: Check the chat history for any message from the AI offering a choice between 'optimized' and 'regular' mode.
step.expected: No such message should be present.

step.content: Verify that the 'optimized' mode is active by checking the mode indicator in the chat interface.
step.expected: The mode indicator should show 'optimized' mode as active.
